info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 6:53PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTH CENTRAL FAIRFIELD... NORTHWESTERN NEW HAVEN AND EASTERN PUTNAM COUNTIES THROUGH 730 PM EDT... At 652 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Sherman, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Waterbury, Danbury, Naugatuck, Southbury, Wolcott, Sherman, Newtown, Cheshire, Brookfield, New Fairfield, Prospect, Middlebury, Beacon Falls, Bethany, and Oxford. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for southern Connecticut...and southeastern New York.
